bolt-url.description: The Bolt URL to connect to the Neo4J server.

chat-language-model.description: The chat language model name of the model used to create cypher queries.

alias.description: The alias which denotes stored secret or credential in the store

type.description: The type of credential this reference is denoting

clear-text.description: Secret specified using clear text (check credential store way of supplying credential/secrets to services)

prompt-template.description: The prompt template used by the chat language model to create cypher queries.

username.description: The username to connect to Neo4J.

in-memory-embedding-store.description: In memory embedding store for AI.

*.description: In memory embedding store for AI.

path.description: The actual filesystem path to be loaded as content of the in-memory embedding store. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

relative-to.description: Reference to a filesystem path defined in the "paths" section of the server configuration.

add.description: This operation adds an in memory embedding store.

path.description: The actual filesystem path to be loaded as content of the in-memory embedding store. Treated as an absolute path, unless the 'relative-to' attribute is specified, in which case the value is treated as relative to that path.

relative-to.description: Reference to a filesystem path defined in the "paths" section of the server configuration.

resolve-path.description: Resolves a relative path of a previously named paths or one of the standard paths provided by the system.

relative-to-only.description: Indicates whether only the relative-to attribute should be resolved or the full path should be resolved. The default is false meaning the entire path will be resolved.

reply-properties.description: The resolved path from the relative path attribute.

remove.description: This operation removes an in memory embedding store.

web-search-content-retriever.description: Content retriever using web search results.

*.description: Content retriever using web search results.

google.description: The custom Google web search engine configuration.

api-key.description: The Google Search API key for accessing the Google Custom Search API.

connect-timeout.description: Timeout for the custom Google search.

custom-search-id.description: The Custom Search ID parameter for search the entire web

include-images.description: If it is true then include public images relevant to the query. This can add more latency to the search.

max-retries.description: The maximum number of retries for API requests.

site-restrict.description: If your Search Engine is restricted to only searching specific sites, you can set this parameter to true.

base-url.description: The base url to access Tavily API.

connect-timeout.description: Timeout for the Tavily API to respond.

exclude-domains.description: A list of domains to specifically exclude from the search results.

include-answer.description: Include answers in the search results.

include-domains.description: A list of domains to specifically include in the search results.

include-raw-content.description: Include raw content in the search results.

search-depth.description: The depth of the search. It can be basic or advanced. Default is basic for quick results and advanced for indepth high quality results but longer response time. Advanced calls equals 2 requests.

add.description: This operation adds the AI subsystem

fail-if-one-server-fails.description: If this is true, then the tool provider will throw an exception if it fails to list tools from any of the servers otherwise the tool provider will ignore the error and continue with the next server.

mcp-clients.description: List of MCP clients used to provide tools.

add.description: This operation adds an MCP Tool provider.

fail-if-one-server-fails.description: If this is true, then the tool provider will throw an exception if it fails to list tools from any of the servers otherwise the tool provider will ignore the error and continue with the next server.

mcp-clients.description: List of MCP clients used to provide tools.

remove.description: This operation removes an MCP Tool provider.

allowed-code-execution.description: Enables the model to generate and run Python code and learn iteratively from the results until it arrives at a final output.

api-key.description: API key to authenticate to a Google Gemini chat model.

civic-integrity.description: Defines the threshold to filter out civic integrity content.

connect-timeout.description: Timeout for the Google Gemini chat model.

dangerous-content.description: Defines the threshold to filter out dangerous content.

enable-enhanced-civic-answers.description: Enables enhanced civic answers. It may not be available for all models.

frequency-penalty.description: Positive values penalize tokens that repeatedly appear in the generated text, decreasing the probability of repeating content.

harassment.description: Defines the threshold to filter out harassment content.

hate-speech.description: Defines the threshold to filter out hate speech content.

include-code-execution-output.description: Enables providing the code and the result in the output.

include-thoughts.description: Enable the return of the thought summaries of the model.

log-probs.description: Returns the log probabilities of the top candidate tokens at each generation step. The model's chosen token might not be the same as the top candidate token at each step. Specify the number of candidates to return by using an integer value in the range of 1-20.

log-requests.description: Enabling the tracing of requests to Google Gemini

log-responses.description: Enabling the tracing of responses to Google Gemini

max-output-token.description: The number of token returned by the Google Gemini chat model.

model-name.description: Name of the model served by Google Gemini.

presence-penalty.description: Presence penalty applied to the next token's logprobs if the token has already been seen in the response. This penalty is binary on/off and not dependant on the number of times the token is used (after the first). Use frequency-penalty for a penalty that increases with each use.

response-format.description: The format of the response from Google Gemini.

response-log-probs.description: If true, returns the log probabilities of the tokens that were chosen by the model at each step.

return-thinking.description: Controls whether to return thinking/reasoning text (if available).

seed.description: When seed is fixed to a specific value, the model makes a best effort to provide the same response for repeated requests. Deterministic output isn't guaranteed.

sexually-explicit.description: Defines the threshold to filter out sexually explicit content.

stop-sequences.description: List of stop sequences to tell the model to stop generating content.

streaming.description: Whether to create a token streaming chat language model or not.

temperature.description: Temperature of the Google Gemini chat model.

thinking-budget.description: Parameter to guide the model on the number of thinking tokens to use when generating a response.

top-k.description: TopK of the Google Gemini chat model.

top-p.description: TopP of the Google Gemini chat model.

avoid-dups.description: If true the object id is a hashed ID based on provided text segment else a random ID will be generated.

consistency-level.description: How the consistency is tuned when writing into weaviate embedding store.

metadata.description: The list of metadata keys to store with an embedding content.

use-aot.description: Enable runtime compiler to translate the WASM instructions to Java bytecode on-the-fly in-memory.

add.description: This operation adds the WASM subsystem

allowed-hosts.description: List of allowed hosts accessible from a WASM module.

*.description: A deployment represents anything that can be deployed (e.g. an application such as Jakarta Enterprise Beans-JAR, WAR, EAR, any kind of standard archive such as RAR or JBoss-specific deployment) into a server.

deployment.description: A list of deployments available for use on the server.

description: Feature pack to provide AI integration for WildFly
